node.title: From last in Toowoomba to Melbourne Cup favourite. This is the rise of Incentivise
node.alt: A man riding a horse with his hand up.
node.description: The five-year-old goes into the Cup on the back of nine straight wins, a streak that began with his maiden victory in April. But his career hasn't always been glorious wins and big pay cheques.
node.content:
["The race that stops the nation will grind Toowoomba to a standstill this afternoon as the region holds its breath for \"our horse\"\u00a0Incentivise.", "The gelding\u00a0bred in southern Queensland is going into the race a\u00a0short-priced favourite (as low as $2.80 overnight), making him one of the most fancied\u00a0horses in the Melbourne Cup since Phar Lap.\u00a0", "It comes\u00a0after Incentivise took home the time-honoured Caulfield Cup \u2014 and a cool $3 million for his owners \u2014 just over two weeks ago.", "Despite the enormity of today's occasion, there's no pressure according to the horse's breeder, original trainer and managing owner, Steve Tregea.", "\"These days don't come along very often;\u00a0we're just happy to win races in Toowoomba and Brisbane on Saturdays, that's what we're normally about,\" he said.", "\"No matter what happens [on Tuesday],\u00a0it'll be a fairytale story because he won the main target that he had for this year\u00a0which was the Caulfield Cup.", "\"This is something unexpected and we're quite happy to accept it.\"", "", "
Incentivise winning at Flemington in early October.(Getty Images: Vince Caligiuri)
", "
Not all smooth sailing\u00a0
", "Incentivise goes into the Cup on the back of nine straight wins, a streak that began with his\u00a0maiden victory at the Sunshine Coast in April.", "But the five-year-old's career hasn't always been glorious wins and big pay cheques;\u00a0a lack of race experience and some bad luck meant his first three starts were ones to forget.", "\"He was alright, he always showed ability and always showed that he was going to want ground or distance in these races,\" Tregea said.", "The last time Incentivise tasted defeat was\u00a0ironically in Toowoomba earlier this year when he was beaten by 16 lengths in a $20,000 maiden handicap.", "Anthony Collins was calling the race that night but said there was something special about him.", "\"I actually said that night, 'Forget it ever went round, he'll win a race',\" he said.", "\"Little did I know that he'd go on to win a Caulfield Cup and be the focus of the $7.7 million Melbourne Cup.", "\"To be somewhat associated with a champion, this sort of stuff only happens to broadcasters like myself once in a career.\"", "
Queensland connections\u00a0
", "Incentivise's fourth victory \u2014 a nine-length romp at Eagle Farm in Brisbane in early June \u2014 caught the attention of some cashed-up suitors and Tregea sold a 50 per cent share.\u00a0", "Part of the deal was to send the horse south for a spring campaign under the care of Peter Moody, the man who guided the career of the great Black Caviar.\u00a0", "For all Moody's success over the years, a Melbourne Cup trophy has eluded him.", "", "
Peter Moody and jockey Brett Prebble after Incentivise won the Caulfield Cup.(Getty Images: Vince Caligiuri)
", "Tregea said Moody's Queensland connections \u2014 he was born and raised in the small western town of Wyandra \u2014 contributed to his decision to send Incentivise south.", "\"I'm basically just a local boy and I don't really want to travel too much,\" Tregea said.", "\"But with the Melbourne carnival coming up it was the obvious situation to send him to one of the top trainers down there who's done it all before in Peter Moody.\u00a0", "
Toowoomba first\u00a0
", "The greatest horse ever to emerge from the Darling Downs\u00a0was the 1940s icon\u00a0Bernborough.\u00a0", "He was so good that he was one of five inaugural inductees into the Australian Racing Hall of Fame alongside the likes of Phar Lap.\u00a0", "But the \"Toowoomba Tornado\" never\u00a0ran in the Melbourne Cup, and with Incentivise on the cusp of winning the great race, there's a hype in the garden city unlike anything before.", "Toowoomba Turf Club chief executive Lizzie King said there was a great buzz around the Clifford Park track.", "\"Toowoomba is the heartland for thoroughbred racing in Queensland;\u00a0we produce amazing equine athletes each and every year, but to see one hit that world stage is so very, very exciting,\" she said.", "\"For it to be one of our own horses that worked here, born and bred on the Downs, it's just that little bit more special."]
